meanings.definition: The action of revising or correcting something.
meanings.sent1: During the revision of his essay, he fixed all the spelling mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The author made a revision to the final draft of his novel before publishing.
meanings.sent3: She found humor in the revision process when she realized she had been correcting the wrong document.
meanings.sent4: The revision of the company's policies breathed new life into the organization.
meanings.sent5: The revision of the painting transformed it into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A revised version or edition of a written work.
meanings.sent1: The new revision of the textbook included updated information on recent discoveries.
meanings.sent2: I prefer this revision of the play because it has a clearer storyline.
meanings.sent3: The librarian chuckled as she shelved the revision of the classic novel for the umpteenth time.
meanings.sent4: Her revised revision of the poem added depth and emotion to the verses.
meanings.sent5: The revision of the recipe made it more flavorful and enjoyable to cook.

meanings.definition: The process of reviewing and studying material in preparation for an exam.
meanings.sent1: Before the exam, she dedicated hours to revision to ensure she understood all the concepts.
meanings.sent2: Effective revision techniques can help improve memory retention for tests.
meanings.sent3: The students laughed during their revision session as they quizzed each other on random facts.
meanings.sent4: Her intense revision before the final paid off with a top score.
meanings.sent5: The revision of the notes made them easier to remember during the test.
